intro: Gnaphalium itinerarii, commonly known as the wandering feathergrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, fluffy flowers that resemble feathery structures. The plant produces numerous tiny, white to pale yellow ray florets, which are typical of the daisy family. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and disturbed soils, often growing in clusters. Gnaphalium itinerarii is known for its ability to spread vegetatively, making it a common sight in various regions across Europe and parts of Asia.
